t: For the director of music. Of David the servant of the Lord.
I*pn have a message from God in my heart concerning*ld the sinfulness of the wicked: There*ln is no fear of God before*ld their eyes.
In*pn their own eyes they flatter themselves too*ld much to detect or hate their sin.
The*ln words of their mouths are wicked and deceitful; they*ld fail to act wisely or do good.
Even*ln on their beds they plot evil; they*ld commit themselves to a sinful course and*ld do not reject what is wrong.
Your*pn love, Lord,*s reaches to the heavens, your*ld faithfulness to the skies.
Your*ln righteousness is like the highest mountains, your*ld justice like the great deep. You,*ld Lord,*s preserve both people and animals.
How*ln priceless is your unfailing love, O God! People*ld take refuge in the shadow of your wings.
They*ln feast on the abundance of your house; you*ld give them drink from your river of delights.
For*ln with you is the fountain of life; in*ld your light we see light.
Continue*pn your love to those who know you, your*ld righteousness to the upright in heart.
May*ln the foot of the proud not come against me, nor*ld the hand of the wicked drive me away.
See*ln how the evildoers lie fallenâ€” thrown*ld down, not able to rise!
